name: Hotel Le Calendal

reviews.text: After reading many of the reviews here prior to staying last week at this excellent 2-star hotel in Arles, I can now see why so many people like it; it's in a central location offering terrific value that isn't out of a stale, mass-market mold.
reviews.title: Superb service in a quaint Provence gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for 6 nights in room 47, a studio unit which opens onto the courtyard and even has a name, pomme d'amour, and is very quaint while still having most modern conveniences. One feature I appreciated was the outer wooden doors that helped block much of the sunlight and allowed me a few later mornings to sleep in as most hotels I find fairly bright or at least brighter than I prefer. There aren't separate rooms with doors for the bathroom, bedroom, closet, etc so is really meant for couples or singles as it doesn't offer lots of privacy. The room did offer a combination safe, remote control TV with a few English channels and air conditioner.
reviews.title: good htel excellent situation

reviews.text: The Calendal does offer a small breakfast for EUR 9 and while I found it quite adequate the first few mornings I began the day with a leisurely morning meal in the well landscaped inner courtyard, it isn't a full, hot buffet meal most North Americans are probably more familiar with. It is a fairly good value unless all you want is a peice of toast and a glass of OJ. There are many restaurants nearby that do offer a light morning meal and may be a few Euro less.
reviews.title: Wonderful as always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free internet access is a nice touch after getting hosed a few times while in Europe in the past at "chain" hotels. Being able to check in with friends & family once or twice was a great bonus.
reviews.title: Great value, location, and city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I can offer one tip it's to watch the taxi service as I'd forgotten that if the driver helps you with your luggage there's an extra fee and upon arrival at the train station in Arles, the cab I took to the Calendal was EUR 11 for a ride which is no more than a few minutes at most. The next few mornings I walked from the hotel to the train station to venture off to Nimes and Avignon and it was no more than a pleasant 15 minute stroll. I did lug my luggage on foot when I departed Arles and it was fairly easy as there weren't too many curbs or obstacles to negotiate.
reviews.title: Antoher thumbs up for Le Calendal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since there were only rave reviews of Le Calendal, we decided to book two nights at this hotel. We agree with some of the comments such as a friendly helpful staff, and an excellent location; however, the accomodations were not stellar and the buffets left little to be desired. We stayed in a small satisfactory room, but definitely nothing to get excited about (bed was uncomfortable, decor was tired, and inadequate lighting). The breakfast buffet was very average (pastries could have been fresher and the fruit served was canned). If you're looking for a value this is a great choice, but certainly make another selection if your means allow for something on the higher-end.
reviews.title: Le Calendal was okay

likes.disliked: — accommodations were not up to my expectations given all the wonderful reviews and the hotel website photos

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at Le Calendal in mid June. We booked this hotel after reading the excellent reviews, and we were not disappointed. I emailed the hotel to make the booking, and Monica was very friendly and efficient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel position was ideal. We came to Arles from Nimes by train, and although it was a ten minute walk from the station, it was completely straightforward.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room (no. 27) on the second floor, overlooked the garden, and was well appointed and very clean, with a very pleasant bathroom. However, it was a little cramped, although adequate, so perhaps it is worth requesting a larger room if this is important to you.
reviews.title: Le Calendal is delightful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thought had clearly gone into providing for their guests. It was possible to have laundry washed and dried - a 6kg load was washed and dried for 8 euros, and an ironing board and iron was available on the first floor - there may have been others elsewhere as we didn't explore every where!The free internet was welcome, umbrellas - we had one drizzly day - magazines and newspapers, games, guide books and above all cheerful advice with a friendly smile at the Reception desk all demonstrated a thoughtful care for the guests.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: We stayed at le Calendal in early August, very much attracted by the reviews on Trip Advisor and elsewhere, and indeed there is much to commend it. Above all, it represents good value for money, has above average levels of service, is run efficiently and is adjacent to the striking Roman amphitheatre. Many of the reviews listed here have mentioned the positives, so it might be worth indicating a few of what for some travellers might seem to be features that might detract from the highest levels of visitor expectations.
reviews.title: Good, but...

reviews.text: Firstly, the decor and the rather worn carpeting on the stairway in the main building and our two rooms could do with refreshing and detracted somewhat from the Provencal feel of the interior design and our double bed sorely needed an new mattrass as it sagged in the middle and compared unfavourably with our other eight nights' stay in 3* hotels elsewhere in the region. (Our bathreeom on the other hand was large, pleadant and equipped to a high standard.
reviews.title: Perfect, perfect, perfect!

likes.liked: — Location, authentic French decor, excellent staff, excellent value

reviews.title: Wonderful location & superb service
reviews.text: Secondly, if one is expecting to be able to make use of the garden for relaxing and reading or simply sitting outside in the warm evenings, one should note that it is unavailable for guests between the hours of 12 and 3 - unless one takes the lunchtime buffet - and is closed by the later evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thirdly, overall the hotel lacks panache and epitomises a sense of 'safeness'in all aspects of its presentation, whether the buffet breakfast (where one is supplied with plastic trays at the tables), the furniture in the public spaces or indeed the general ethos of the place.
reviews.title: Great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has free wi-fi access and access to computers, is close to a number of good restaurants (Le Criquet represents good value and cuisine), and is well-situated for visiting the main Roman and medieval sites. A stay at Le Calendal will be unproblematic, represent very good value for money and will be attractive enough to many travellers who may see the brightly-coloured and patterned decor as typical of Provence.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel to be very comfortable, and with about the friendliest and most helpful staff of anyplace we stayed during two weeks in Provence. We were not part of the bike touring or Rick Steeves groups, but were treated wonderfully throughout. A very good bed in a room looking out over the garden. The location -- as shown in the pictures -- is absolutely central: the amphitheater is just yards away. Suggest reserving one of the hotel's relatively few parking places, as driving/parking in the old city is a nightmare. The staff was also helpful in recommending restaurants that suited us.
reviews.title: Great value and location
Good hotel
reviews.text: Bill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not much to add, based on what everyone else has said. We booked after reading Rick Steves and all the reviews on this site and wasn't disappointed. A few quick points:
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) Driving through Arles is a NIGHTMARE. The streets are TINY. We were warned but seriously, was shocked at how small some of the roads are. We got lost a few times trying to find the hotel and went down some roads that were it not for the miniscule curb, would have thought it was a pedestrian only street. Not to worry, the hotel has access to city parking garage.
reviews.title: Location, simplicity, economy, charm

likes.disliked: — The room was small and a bit musty, but no problem if you're out as soon as your hit hits the pillow!

reviews.text: 2) Liked that there was 3 computers with internet access in the lobby. I never had to wait more than 2 minutes.
reviews.title: Provincial Provence Paradise

likes.disliked: — First impression from the outside- but it quickly changed

description: The HOTEL SPA LE Calendal in Arles ideally located between the Antic Theater and Amphitheater, in historical center. A charming hotel, comfortable and stylish. A "restaurant d'été" with provencal dishes is open in season from mid march till mid october at lunch . The Spa Aux Bains du Calendal offers roman baths and roman ambiance (adults only +18 years old). Hot Bath - massage shower and Hammam. Large variety of massages also available .
